docs.summary: Creates a reward that can be redeemed with loyalty points.
description:
When a customer redeems a reward, a loyalty coupon is created
based on the specifications detailed in either the `discountAmount` or `couponReward` fields. This coupon can
then be used by the customer to receive the discount. Note that while the Rewards API uses coupon scopes and specifications,
no coupon is actually created until a reward is redeemed with points.
See the Coupons API for more information about coupons.

A reward's `active` status defaults to `false`. To make the reward available to customers,
either set the `active` field to `true` during creation or call [`updateReward()`](#updatereward)
to change the status.

To customize a reward for each loyalty tier, use the `configsByTier` parameter.
This allows you to specify the amount of the earned discount, the cost in loyalty points
to redeem the reward, and the tier to which this configuration applies. Each tier requires its own
`configsByTier` configuration. To create a reward that is available to loyalty accounts in the base tier,
leave the `tierId` field empty. See the Loyalty Tiers API for more information on tiers.

params.name: _id
params.doc: ID of the reward to delete.

params.name: revision
params.doc:
Revision number, which increments by `"1"` each time the reward is updated.

To prevent conflicting changes, the current `revision` must be passed when deleting the reward.

params.name: _id
params.doc: ID of the reward to retrieve.

description:
Only rewards with `"active"` set to `"true"` will be retrieved. The list includes rewards that are currently
unredeemable due to insufficient points held by any customers.

Use this endpoint to update details of a reward, such as the name, whether or not a reward is active,
or the amount of points it costs to redeem. Also use this endpoint to add new tiers that are eligible to redeem a reward.

You may not change the `type` of a reward. That is set upon creation and cannot be updated.

members.doc: Total successes and failures of the bulk create rewards action.

members.doc: Created rewards.

members.name: requiredPoints
members.doc: Amount of points required to receive the reward.

members.name: tierId
members.doc: Tier ID, or empty if config applies to the base tier.

members.name: appliesToSubscriptions
members.doc:
Whether the coupon applies to subscription products.

If set to `true`, the discount will apply to all billing cycles.

members.name: discountedCycleCount
members.doc: Reserved for internal use.

members.name: fixedAmount
members.doc: Discount as a fixed amount.

members.name: freeShipping
members.doc: Free shipping.

members.name: limitedToOneItem
members.doc: Whether the coupon is limited to one item.

members.name: minimumSubtotal
members.doc: Limit the coupon to carts with a subtotal greater than this number.

members.name: percentage
members.doc: Discount as a percentage.

members.name: scope
members.doc:
Specifies the type of line items this coupon will apply to.

For more information, see the Coupons API.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: hasNext
members.doc:
Indicates if there are more results after the current page.
If `true`, another page of results can be retrieved.
If `false`, this is the last page.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: filter
sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous page in the list of results.

members.doc: ID of the reward to delete.

members.name: revision

Revision number, which increments by `"1"` each time the reward is updated.

To prevent conflicting changes, the current `revision` must be passed when deleting the reward.

members.name: configsByTier
members.doc: Discount details for each tier.

members.name: amount
members.doc: Discount amount. Must be a positive value.

members.name: costInPoints
members.doc: Amount of points required to redeem the reward.

members.name: tierId
members.doc: Tier ID, or empty if config applies to the base tier.

description: TODO after migration for cost_in_points use [(wix.api.min) = 1, (wix.api.max) = 9999999];

members.name: _id
members.doc: random GUID so clients can tell if event was already handled

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc:
Assuming that all messages including Actions have id
Example: The id of the specific order, the id of a specific campaign

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: The time of the event. Useful if there was a delay in dispatching

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
A field that should be set if this event was triggered by an anonymize request.
For example you must set it to true when sending an event as a result of a GDPR right to be forgotten request.
NOTE: This field is not relevant for `EntityCreatedEvent` but is located here for better ergonomics of consumers.

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: originalIndex
members.doc: Index of the item within the request array. Allows for correlation between request and response items.

members.name: success
members.doc: Whether the requested action was successful for this item. When `false`, the `error` field is populated.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query. Returned if offset paging is used and the `tooManyToCount` flag is not set.

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the reward was created.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Reward ID.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the reward was last updated.

members.name: active
members.doc:
Whether the reward is active.

Default: `"false"`

members.name: couponReward
members.doc: Coupon details.

members.name: discountAmount
members.doc: Discount details.

members.name: name
members.doc: Reward name.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by `"1"` each time the loyalty reward is updated.

To prevent conflicting changes, the current `revision` must be passed when updating the loyalty reward.

members.name: type
members.doc:
Reward type.

+ `"DISCOUNT_AMOUNT"`: Discount reward. Only available for Wix Restaurants. [Learn more about discounts.](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-restaurants-creating-discounts-for-your-customers)
+ `"COUPON_REWARD"`: Coupon reward. [Learn more about coupons.](https://support.wix.com/en/article/using-coupons-as-loyalty-rewards)
+ `"COUPON"`: **Deprecated.** Use `"COUPON_REWARD"` instead.

description:
A loyalty reward is an object a customer can redeem with loyalty points.
Redeeming a reward then creates a loyalty coupon that the customer can use.

members.name: couponReward
members.doc: Coupon details.

members.name: discountAmount
members.doc: Discount details.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Reward ID.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the reward was last updated.

members.name: active
members.doc:
Whether the reward is active.

Default: `"false"`

members.doc: Coupon details.

members.name: discountAmount
members.doc: Discount details.

members.name: name
members.doc: Reward name.

members.name: revision
members.doc:
Revision number, which increments by `"1"` each time the loyalty reward is updated.

To prevent conflicting changes, the current `revision` must be passed when updating the loyalty reward.

members.name: type
members.doc:
Reward type.

+ `"DISCOUNT_AMOUNT"`: Discount reward. Only available for Wix Restaurants. [Learn more about discounts.](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-restaurants-creating-discounts-for-your-customers)
+ `"COUPON_REWARD"`: Coupon reward. [Learn more about coupons.](https://support.wix.com/en/article/using-coupons-as-loyalty-rewards)
+ `"COUPON"`: **Deprecated.** Use `"COUPON_REWARD"` instead.
